We created 13 petabytes of fit-for-purpose biological data. Want to work with it?  When combined with the right algorithms, data can do amazing things: it can encourage strangers to buy something or to click an ad, it can suggest a video or what word might want to use next. Those problems are clearly challenging and interesting, but why not use data science to tackle problems that have plagued humanity for generations: to revolutionize how we recognize and treat disease to directly improve lives and reduce suffering?  Wouldn't that be a career you could be proud of?  Recursion is the clinical-stage biotechnology company industrializing drug discovery by decoding biology. Recursion leverages sophisticated machine-learning algorithms to distill from its dataset the Recursion Map, a collection of hundreds of billions of searchable inferences across biology and chemistry unconstrained by human bias. As a data scientist at Recursion, you can make an even greater impact on human health and impact more lives than physicians treating one patient at a time. Data scientists at Recursion do science: from designing well-controlled experiments to building models and interpreting results, your skill and expertise can help us infer new compounds and treatments for diseases impacting people around the world.  Beyond the obvious impact you could make, Recursion is designed for data scientists. You will be a part of a team of 30+ data scientists managing 13 petabytes of data, all generated internally and to our specifications' specifications in an automated lab mere feet from where you work. Beyond scale, the secret sauce is that the data lives as a relatable dataset, fit-for-purpose directly answering complex experimental research questions.  You'll be joining Recursion at an interesting time, both for the company and for the world. The global pandemic has reinforced in everyone's mind not only the importance of therapeutics, but also the critical value that accelerating every phase of drug discovery can provide. For most, the notion that "patients can't wait" is abstract; COVID-19 has made this concept all too real for millions, even billions, worldwide. Every week, you'll work hand-in-glove with our science teams, turning +1.5 million weekly automated experiments into a map of human biology.  It is an audacious goal, but it isn't a dream or science fiction. It's something we're already doing.  The Impact You'll Make  With treatments for hundreds of diseases in our sights, we've built a data science team with domain expertise in computer science, bioinformatics, physics, biology, mathematics, applied statistics, and more. We work side-by-side with biologists, automation scientists, chemists, software engineers, and many others; together, we develop the tools and methods to turn our experimental data into treatments for pathologies that affect the lives of countless individuals.  In this role, you will be a computational and analytical expert who develops scalable solutions that impact our drug discovery pipeline.   Strategize  in collaboration with biologists, engineers, and data/ML scientists on the next steps for industrializing various stages of the drug discovery process.  Explore  novel metrics, analyses, or models to answer unresolved biological questions about our data generation processes or downstream applications.  Deliver  scalable software tools for the evaluation and communication of data generated by Recursion's high-dimensional, high-throughput assay platform.   The Team You'll Join  You will be joining a fast-growing, cross-functional team with expertise in biology, automation engineering, data science, software engineering, and product development. You can expect to be challenged with new scientific domains, high expectations for analytical software development, unresolved questions about analytical methods and applications, and ambitious goals to industrialize various aspects of the drug discovery process. Specifically, your team will focus on developing and scaling cellular models of disease for use in a wide range of research programs. A bold, creative, collaborative, growth-oriented, and team-first mindset will be critical to the success of both individuals and teams in this exceptionally challenging and exciting industry.
